yaml.title: EU StudyAssist
yaml.subtitle: R for Research Test II (23rd August, 2024)

markdown.markdown:
-   Wait until `WEBR status` is **Ready**. This should take 15 seconds at the most depending on your internet connection speed.
-   Do not reload the page as progress made is not recorded.
-   Remember to load your packages, if it doesn't load, you can always install them.
-   You have forty minutes to answer the questions.

:::{.callout-important}
**Do not reload the page.**
:::

 **Good luck!!**

```{webr-r}
#| context: setup
install.packages(c("tidyverse", "readxl", "googlesheets4", "readODS", "car", "skimr", "janitor"))
url <- "https://raw.githubusercontent.com/xrander/bootcamp-test/master/data/inventory_data.csv"
download.file(url, "inventory_data.csv")
```

# Question 1.

There's a csv file named **"inventory_data.csv"**, import the file correctly, give it a variable name of your choice and print the last 6 observations

```{webr-r}
```

# Question 2.

Using any appropriate R function print the variable names of the file you just imported.

```{webr-r}
```

# Question 3.

What is the correlation between `area_ha` and `volume_m3_ha`.

```{webr-r}
```

# Question 3b.

Is the data positively or negatively correlated?

> "Negatively correlated"

#4. Filter the data to return trees that have a the **minimum age** of **141**. With your result, draw a graph of `area_ha` on the **x-axis** and `volume_m3_ha` on the **y-axis**, and color / fill by species. 

:::{.callout-note appearance="minimal"}
The type of graph to draw is up to you
:::

```{webr-r}

```

4b. Which species is having the highest volume from the result of your graph?


5. Find the mean increment for each tree species. Arrange your result in descending order of mean increment.

```{webr-r}

```

6. From the result above, what species is having the highest mean increment? Show this graphically and change the fill color(s) with a color of your choosing. 

:::{.callout-warning}
Do not return the default color. You must choose a color.
:::

```{webr-r}
```


7. Produce a box plot for the volume of each species.
```{webr-r}
```

7b. Is the above graph a good representation of the volume of the trees?

> **No**

8. Draw a line graph of `volume_m3_ha` **vs** `age_max`. Color the lines with species
```{webr-r}
```

8b. What can you deduce from the line graph?


9. Draw a line graph of `volume_m3_ha` vs `age_max`. Color the lines with species and let each species have their own plots.

:::{.calloout-tip}
`volume_m3_ha` in y-axis and `age_max` in x-axis
The `facet_wrap()` function might be something to consider.
:::

```{webr-r}
```

10. Create a new variable named `mean_age`. The data of `mean_age` is the average of `age_max` and `age_min`. 
```{webr-r}
```
markdown.srcMarkdownNoYaml:
# Instructions
-   Wait until `WEBR status` is **Ready**. This should take 15 seconds at the most depending on your internet connection speed.
